definitions.definition: One of a long series of boards laid from side to side as a path across wet or muddy ground; normally used in plural.

parsedExamples.example: In an attempt to alleviate the problem, wooden planking, known as duckboards, was placed at the bottom of trenches and across other areas of muddy or waterlogged ground.

examples: In an attempt to alleviate the problem, wooden planking, known as duckboards, was placed at the bottom of trenches and across other areas of muddy or waterlogged ground.
